description: In this lesson, Tariq Harb teaches the expressive technique of Portamento. The lesson begins with a look at the differences between “Glissando” and “Portamento” which although distinctly different are often used interchangeably. He then goes on to give examples of using Portamento in different pieces from the late-Romantic repertoire.
title: On Portamento

description: Frederic Hand teaches his beautiful composition, Missing Her. After walking through the first section of the piece, Hand shares his approach to the improvised middle section of the piece and breaks down steps that students can use to learn improvisation.
title: Missing Her (Hand)

description: Tal Hurwitz sits down to discuss his life with the guitar, thoughts on composing, and tips for classical guitar students. In addition, Hurwitz touches on the idea of achieving “technical perfection” and whether such a thing is possible as well as the role of competitions in a player's development.
title: Interview With Tal Hurwitz (Berlin, 2018)

description: Igor joins Manuel Barrueco in his office at Peabody University for an insightful conversation about his life experiences growing up in Cuba, moving to the United States, and studying with Aaron Sheaer. In addition, Barrueco shares his thoughts on career develop and the path that led him to an incredibly successful career as a performing musician.
title: Interview With Manuel Barrueco (Baltimore, 2018)

description:
In this lesson, Vladimir Gorbach breaks down his approach to developing fast scales.

When practicing scales, Gorbach aims to maintain control of the fingers at all times and therefore begins his study at an initially slow tempo. After walking through a brief warm up exercise and discussing rest and free stroke differences, Gorbach guides you step-by-step through the different levels of speeding up your scales. Play along and see what BPM you can reach with one, two, three, and four notes per beat.

To end, Gorbach recommends practicing scales every two days, so be sure to return to this lesson and continue your development!
title: On Scales

description: In this interview, Igor from tonebase sits down with Maestro Fisk to discuss his opinion on competitions and how he tried to make the Boston Guitar Fest stand out from the rest. In addition, Fisk shares tips for students on starting a career and where to look for inspiration.
title: Interview With Eliot Fisk (Boston, 2017)

description:
In this interview at the 2017 GFA Convention, Scott Tennant gives his thoughts and insights on competitions, sharing his experience from his competing days as well as being a jury member.

Tennant also covers the creation process and the motivation behind his world-standard technique book “Pumping Nylon.' The interview ends with his advice for aspiring students on how to kickstart their professional careers.
title: Interview With Scott Tennant (Fullerton, 2017)

description:
Learn one of the classical guitar repertoire’s most iconic pieces - Koyunbaba by Carlo Domeniconi - taught here by Turkish-born virtuoso Celil Refik Kaya.

In this lesson, you will discover the cultural origins of the piece which Celil traces back to a Turkish folk instrument called the Bağlama. While walking through the composition, Celil points out particular motifs that are commonly found in Turkish music and demonstrates the proper way to play them.

For the fast-paced ending, Celil breaks down the fingerings and philosophies he uses to make the technical challenges more manageable, including where to look when making large jumps and how to achieve the right sound for the tapping technique known as “Şelpe.”
title: Koyunbaba (Domeniconi)
